text: I don't normally read ALA, but this one caught my eye today <http://alistapart.com/article/axiomatic-css-and-lobotomized-owls>

attachments.title: Axiomatic CSS and Lobotomized Owls
attachments.text: Managing flow content can get unwieldy—too many class selectors can become a specificity headache, nested styling can get redundant, and content editors don’t always understand the presentational markup. Heydon Pickering offers an unexpected option for handling cascading styles more efficiently: a variation on the universal selector.
